com.adobe.granite.crypto.spi

Interface KeyProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    KeyProviderBase

    public interface KeyProvider
    The KeyProvider provides a simple API to obtain cryptographic keys stored in a storage system.The underlying storage system is indicated by the getLabel() method. Currently supported algorithm are defined in Algorithms

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String STORAGE_SUPPORT
      The service registration property indicating which storage support to use for this bundle instance ("granite.crypto.storage").

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getStorageType()
      Returns a short description of the support bundle to indicate what kind of storage is going to be used.
      byte[] obtainKey(Algorithms algorithm)
      Obtain the current cryptographic key present in the storage.

    • Field Detail

      • STORAGE_SUPPORT

        static final java.lang.String STORAGE_SUPPORT
        The service registration property indicating which storage support to use for this bundle instance ("granite.crypto.storage").
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getStorageType

        java.lang.String getStorageType()
        Returns a short description of the support bundle to indicate what kind of storage is going to be used.
        Returns:
        a short human readable description

      • obtainKey

        byte[] obtainKey(Algorithms algorithm)
          throws CryptoException
        Obtain the current cryptographic key present in the storage. The storage used for the key returned must be protected by additional means such as access control against abuse of the key. The key is generated once at startup via the KeyGenerator and stays the same for the lifetime of the service (unless is physically erased in the storage system)
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the standard string name of the algorithm. Currently supported algorithm are defined in Algorithms
        Returns:
        the related stored key
        Throws:
        CryptoException - If any problem occurs while obtaining the key
